Aortic valvular regurgitation refers to a condition in which blood flows backwards from the aorta into the heart due to a malfunctioning aortic valve. This can also cause enlargement of the heart and other complications. This can lead to decreased blood flow to the body and other complications.  Insufficiency in job function may be related to any of the above cardiac conditions, as decreased blood flow to the body can cause fatigue and other symptoms.  LAE or left atrial enlargement, is a condition in which the left atrium of the heart becomes enlarged. This can cause problems with heart function and may be related to the patient's other cardiac conditions.
